column5: Well with the hardwater season still a week or two away, I decided to take a nature walk up to one of Lake xxx's As I headed out the back door I looked over at the Picnic table and was shocked at what I seen,Maybe snowhoes would come in handy    A short walk over to one of the '' Bird Feeders '' = BlueJay     And off I go , After crossing several mountains I meet up with a Beaver    A couple of deer showed up to play      Finally I reach the trail to Paradise.........    When I get to the lake I see a RedTail hawk watching over it    At the lake it was snowing pretty good , But all was well and almost ready     The End........
Deer, beaver, hawk & blue jay.....I'd say you had an excellent day
Cool Paul.... Loved the shots of the deers, especially the first pic between the trees    super shot Thanks for sharing Jacques
Very nice pics Paul. Thank you for sharing that. I'd also say you've had an excellent day!
Very nice, I love nature pics.  Looks like it was a great hike  Joey
Okay..now I've put apples with apples... read this elsewhere this morning. Now I understand the "bashing" better... between pals ! lol  Some great shots there !!!
Nice scenery, and I can't get over how deep the snow is! Here in Mississauga (Toronto) we have had a dusting, that will be gone by tomorrow.
That is alot of snow! We only have about 6" up here. Nice pictures, looks like a nice walk. Oh, and I think that is probably a rough-legged hawk.
WTG! Nice pictures. Thanks for sharing.
Nice! Lots of wildlife and great pictures!  Thanks for posting that. ehg
These pics are amazing! May not have a good fishing trip, but the wildlife you saw makes up for it
winter sure can be pretty when you have fresh snow like that!  Thanks for sharing!  Cheers!
